posts.post_content:
4 of these  
4 Pillars of flame, 4 Worldfires (sorceries = win con)  
4 legion loyalist, 4 lightning maulers, + 4-8 of your favorite dragons.  
fill in the rest with whatever burn control you want. I feel an obligation to make that deck for the lolz.  
this card will ruin whatever well-layed plans your opponent had (hey, feel like casting something randomly from your deck?)  
and once you get this out, pillar of flame and try to hit a world fire. or legion loyalist to hit a dragon. everything else instant to keep the board clear until t5/6.  
  
Oh, the places you'll go!

posts.post_content:
Get 1x [Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded) and 1x [Grim Discovery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Discovery) (or any other 2CMC Sorcery that's in Grixis Colors). Then, get 4x [Dimir Infiltrator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dimir Infiltrator), [Muddle the Mixture](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Muddle the Mixture), and 4x [Shred Memory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shred Memory): these are 2CMC cards with Transmute, so they can be used as tutors for your Tibalt/Grim Discovery.  
Then put in 1x [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker), 1x [Sorin Markov](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin Markov), 1x [Karn Liberated](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karn Liberated)... Basically all the good planeswalkers that can win the game for you relatively quickly upon being put into play.  
Also put in a few copies of [Time Stretch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stretch), [Cruel Ultimatum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cruel Ultimatum), [Sorin's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin's Vengeance), maybe [Violent Ultimatum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Violent Ultimatum) to deal with [Leyline of Sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Sanctity) etc. Remember, if your sorcery has no valid targets when you reveal it, you can choose not to cast it and it'll go back ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Get 1x Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded and 1x Grim Discovery (or any other 2CMC Sorcery that's in Grixis Colors). Then, get 4x Dimir Infiltrator, Muddle the Mixture, and 4x Shred Memory: these are 2CMC cards with Transmute, so they can be used as tutors for your Tibalt/Grim Discovery.
Then put in 1x Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker, 1x Sorin Markov, 1x Karn Liberated... Basically all the good planeswalkers that can win the game for you relatively quickly upon being put into play.
Also put in a few copies of Time Stretch, Cruel Ultimatum, Sorin's Vengeance, maybe Violent Ultimatum to deal with Leyline of Sanctity etc. Remember, if your sorcery has no valid targets when you reveal it, you can choose not to cast it and it'll go back ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
I like cards like this. This will be fun to exploit.  
  
Important to read is that it says "from your hand". Flashback will dodge this card, as do cards played from cascading, or copies from storm. This card especially wants to be played with the [descendant of soratami](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=descendant of soratami) or a [scroll rack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=scroll rack) to manipulate your polymorph effect!
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
So what happens if a person who has no others of that spell type in their library to cast?   
  
Say I have only two instants and i already cast the other one and its in my graveyard.  
I cast the second one and start exiling cards but have no other instants to cast so i exile my entire library without casting a second card. Does nothing get cast and everything is shuffled, or does everything stay exiled and my library is empty?
posts.html:
So what happens if a person who has no others of that spell type in their library to cast?

Say I have only two instants and i already cast the other one and its in my graveyard.
I cast the second one and start exiling cards but have no other instants to cast so i exile my entire library without casting a second card. Does nothing get cast and everything is shuffled, or does everything stay exiled and my library is empty?

posts.post_content:
[Melek, Izzet Paragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Melek, Izzet Paragon) has some wonderful synergy with this.   
  
Spells you cast from your library aren't affected, and he lets you know whether you'll get good value from expensive spells you cast from your hand.  
Melek reveals a land you don't need? Play a spell from your hand.  
  
Meanwhile, your opponent is left playing blind.
posts.html:
Melek, Izzet Paragon has some wonderful synergy with this.

Spells you cast from your library aren't affected, and he lets you know whether you'll get good value from expensive spells you cast from your hand.
Melek reveals a land you don't need? Play a spell from your hand.

Meanwhile, your opponent is left playing blind.

posts.post_content:
I had one epic EDH game where this became my saving grace.   
  
On the field, I had [Grip of Chaos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grip of Chaos), [Ensnaring Bridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ensnaring Bridge), and [Timesifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timesifter) out. As the game went on, it became very clear that none of those permanents were going to die.   
  
See, my friend had a [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) in his hand soon after I played these three. He, unlike me and my other friend, had very low-CMC spells. So out of the 20 or so TImesifter turns, he only had 2. He became quickly frustrated since he couldn't stop this.  
  
Every time one of us played a spell, it would go to the Possibility Storm. One of them played a [Blue Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blue Sun's Zenith) for ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol) and got [Reins of Power](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reins of Power) (which did nothing important). I played a [No Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=No Mercy) which turned into a [Bloodchief Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodchief Ascension). Regardless of he amount of turns we all got, almost nothing productive happened. A shame that one of them Storm'd i... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
The obligatory red Johnny card, and I love it. :) I played against a younger player who ran this in his DGR draft deck, and it was hilarious. It didn't do him any good, but we had a blast while it was out. Heh .. literally? One time I cast an instant of some kind and flipped [Blast of Genius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blast of Genius) ... as the second-to-last card in my library.  
  
I thought maybe you could do something silly with this and [Knowledge Pool](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knowledge Pool), but I don't think it's quite as goofy as I thought it might be.  
  
But yeah, playing this with [Curse of Exhaustion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Exhaustion) is kind of a jerk thing to do, but it works pretty well, doesn't it?  
  
Ah, the possibilities... :3
posts.html:

I thought maybe you could do something silly with this and Knowledge Pool, but I don't think it's quite as goofy as I thought it might be.

posts.post_content: Have a [Research](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Research) in hand, an ornithopter, 1 cmc sorceries or instants, and this in hand. [Selective Memory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selective Memory) yourself to remove everything you can. Research oh let's say a [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) or fun things like[Inferno](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inferno). I still lost, but my friend could not figure out what I was doing!

So the judges at my local shop swear that the third ruling is wrong....that WHENEVER is a replacement effect and only one of those can be used per spell so another THIS exiled spell doesnt trigger the other THIS or somthing like that....its darn confusing cause I so want those guys to be WRONG.   
  
Also there isnt a mill effect here I dont think Nirvana one of the aforementioned dudes already tried it....everything goes back on the bottom....  
  
We all could be wrong....this is a complex spell....
